app_subtitle: Dojo - Live online Markdown editor with quick start examples
hero_description:
Free online Markdown editor with live preview.
Write Markdown and see formatted HTML in real time.
Supports GitHub Flavored Markdown. No sign-up required.
what_is_markdown_p1: Markdown preview allows you to write content using Markdown syntax and instantly see how it will look when rendered as formatted HTML. Instead of guessing how your Markdown will appear, a live preview helps you write faster and avoid formatting errors.
what_is_markdown_p2: Markdown is widely used for documentation, README files, blogs, technical writing, and note-taking. With an online Markdown preview tool, you can work directly in your browser without installing any software.
why_use_editor_title: Why Use an Online Markdown Editor?
why_use_editor_p1: An online Markdown editor with live preview is the easiest way to write and test Markdown content. It removes the need for local setup and works on any device with a browser.
why_use_editor_li1: Instantly preview Markdown as formatted content
why_use_editor_li3: Works on desktop, tablet, and mobile
why_use_editor_li4: Perfect for quick edits and sharing
key_features_li3: Markdown diff tool to compare Markdown documents
key_features_li4: Support for GitHub Flavored Markdown syntax
key_features_li5: Free to use with no registration
key_features_li6: Fast and privacy-friendly (your content stays in your browser)
common_use_cases_p1: MarkdownPreview.org is designed for a wide range of users who work with Markdown on a daily basis.
common_use_cases_li1: Previewing README.md files for GitHub repositories
common_use_cases_li2: Writing technical documentation and developer guides
common_use_cases_li4: Comparing different versions of Markdown documents
markdown_diff_section_title: Markdown Diff: Compare Markdown Files Online
markdown_diff_section_p1_prefix: In addition to live preview, MarkdownPreview.org provides a
markdown_diff_section_p1_suffix: . It allows you to compare two Markdown texts and highlight the differences. This is especially useful when reviewing documentation changes or comparing different versions of a README file.
markdown_diff_section_formatter_title: Markdown Formatter: Clean Up and Standardize Your Markdown
markdown_diff_section_formatter_prefix: Markdown Formatter is a companion tool focused on cleaning up and standardizing Markdown documents.
markdown_diff_section_formatter_suffix: to apply safe, reviewable fixes with a built-in diff preview before you commit any changes.
editor_upload_error_invalid_type: Unsupported file type. Please upload text files (.md, .txt, .json, etc.)

markdown_diff_description: Compare two Markdown documents and review changes with semantic, block-aware diff.
markdown_diff_source_hint: Left input acts as the baseline Markdown.
markdown_diff_target_hint: Right input is the version you want to check.
markdown_diff_target_tip: Tip: You can upload a .md file or paste content directly.
markdown_diff_result_hint: We only render differences after you click the button.
markdown_diff_result_hint_active: Showing differences only. Use filters to refine the view.
markdown_diff_options_hint: Normalize text before diffing to ignore whitespace noise.
markdown_diff_option_ignore_whitespace_h: Collapse spaces and tabs so alignment changes do not count as differences.
markdown_diff_option_ignore_blank_lines_: Drop empty rows before comparing to focus on meaningful content.
markdown_diff_option_ignore_line_endings: Normalize Windows and Unix line endings before diffing.
markdown_diff_option_trim_trailing_space: Strip whitespace at the end of each line so accidental padding is skipped.
markdown_diff_option_case_insensitive_hi: Lowercase both sides before diffing to ignore casing differences.
markdown_diff_outline_hint: Jump between change blocks. Counts show added and removed lines.
markdown_diff_idle: Add content on both sides and hit â€œRun diffâ€ to see changes.
markdown_diff_no_changes: No differences found. Both inputs are identical.
markdown_diff_no_changes_hint: The two files are completely identical with no differences.
markdown_diff_upload_file_hint: Click to upload or drag file here
markdown_diff_upload_error_invalid_type: Unsupported file type. Please upload text files (.md, .txt, .json, etc.)
markdown_diff_upload_error_too_large: File too large. Maximum size is 10MB
markdown_diff_upload_error_read_failed: Failed to read file. Please try again
quickstart_description: See how Markdown stays close to plain text while staying expressive. Drop any snippet into the editor and watch the preview update.
quickstart_hint: Use these cards as a fast lookup next to the editor.
quickstart_intro_description: Headings, emphasis, and links keep content readable without leaving plain text.
quickstart_intro_snippet:
# Title

Plain text paragraph with **bold**, *italic*, and a [link](https://example.com).
quickstart_paragraphs_description: Control spacing with blank lines and soft breaks for tighter layout.
quickstart_paragraphs_snippet:
First line of text
continues with a soft break

New paragraph after a blank line  
Forced line break with two spaces.
quickstart_tables_description: Use pipes and dashes; colons align columns in GitHub Flavored Markdown.
quickstart_tables_snippet:
| Feature | Support |
| :-- | :--: |
| Alignment | Yes |
| Header row | Required |
quickstart_code_description: Backticks wrap inline code; triple backticks fence blocks with language hints.
quickstart_code_snippet:
Use `code` for inline.

```js
const hello = (name) => 'Hi, ' + name + '!'
```
quickstart_math_description: Wrap LaTeX inline with \( ... \) or display mode with $$ ... $$ when supported.
quickstart_math_snippet:
Inline: \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\)

Display:
$$
E = mc^2
$$
quickstart_lists_description: Mix ordered, unordered, and task lists to structure steps and ideas.
quickstart_lists_snippet:
- Bullet item
- Nested items
  - Indent two spaces
1. Ordered list
2. Next step
- [ ] Task to start
- [x] Task done
quickstart_image_description: Insert images with an exclamation mark and brackets; the path goes in parentheses.
quickstart_links_description: Create hyperlinks with brackets and parentheses; supports relative paths and absolute URLs.
faq_a1: Yes. MarkdownPreview.org is completely free and does not require registration.
faq_q2: Does this online Markdown editor store my content?
faq_a2: No. All Markdown content is processed directly in your browser. Your text is not uploaded or stored on our servers.
faq_a3: The editor supports standard Markdown syntax and GitHub Flavored Markdown, including code blocks, tables, lists, and links.
faq_a4: This tool is ideal for developers, technical writers, bloggers, students, and anyone who writes Markdown content.
diff_faq_q1: What makes this Markdown diff different from a plain text diff?
diff_faq_a1: Enter your original Markdown content in the left input, and the version you want to compare in the right input. Then click the "Run diff" button. The tool will automatically highlight all differences, including additions, deletions, and modifications.
diff_faq_q2: What formats are supported for comparison?
diff_faq_a2: This tool is specifically designed for comparing Markdown-formatted text. It supports all standard Markdown syntax, including headings, lists, code blocks, tables, links, and more. Differences are highlighted at both line and word levels.
diff_faq_q3: How do I navigate between different changes?
diff_faq_a3: After differences are detected, you can use the "Prev change" and "Next change" buttons to jump between multiple changes. The tool will automatically scroll to the corresponding change location, making it easy to quickly locate and review each modification.
diff_faq_a4: No. All comparison operations are performed locally in your browser. Data is not sent to any server and is not saved. You'll need to re-enter content after refreshing the page.
diff_page_how_it_works_p1: Instead of comparing Markdown files as plain text only, this tool understands Markdown structure. It splits documents into meaningful blocks such as headings, lists, tables, and code blocks before running the diff.
diff_page_how_it_works_p2: This approach reduces noise and helps you focus on real content changes, especially when working with documentation, README files, or technical notes.
diff_page_language_support_p1: Word-level diff works best for space-separated languages such as English. For languages like Japanese, Chinese, or Korean, diff results may be less granular due to language characteristics.
diff_page_language_support_p2: Line-level and block-level diff remain accurate across all languages.
diff_page_privacy_p1: All comparisons run entirely in your browser. Markdown content is never uploaded or stored on a server. Recent history is saved locally using browser storage only.
diff_page_use_cases_li1: Comparing different versions of README.md files
diff_page_use_cases_li4: Auditing content updates in technical documents

related_tools_preview_description: Write Markdown and see live preview instantly. Great for testing syntax before you diff.
related_tools_diff_description: Compare two Markdown documents and review changes with semantic, block-aware diff.
related_tools_formatter_description: Automatically format your Markdown using safe, deterministic rules with diff preview.
related_tools_guides_description: Practical guides for README, tables, code blocks, and Markdown tips you can try in the editor.
formatter_title: Markdown Formatter with Safe Auto-Fix & Diff Preview
formatter_description: Automatically format your Markdown using safe, deterministic rules. Review every change with word-level diff before applying.
formatter_value_safe_desc:
Only applies 100% safe fixes.
No content rewriting. No surprises.
formatter_value_diff_desc:
See exactly what will change with word-level diff
before applying anything.
formatter_value_undo_desc:
Apply, undo, or fine-tune rules.
Nothing is forced on you.
formatter_value_quality_desc:
Go beyond formatting with lint
and writing quality checks in advanced mode.
formatter_faq_q1: Is this a Markdown formatter or a linter?
formatter_faq_a1: It's both. By default, it works as a safe Markdown formatter. In advanced mode, you can enable lint and writing quality checks.
formatter_faq_a2: No. Only deterministic formatting fixes are applied. All changes are previewed with a diff before applying.
formatter_faq_q3: How is this different from Prettier?
formatter_faq_a3: Prettier focuses on full reformatting. This tool focuses on minimal, reviewable, and safe formatting.
formatter_faq_q4: Can I use this in CI?
formatter_faq_a4: Yes. You can export results as JSON or SARIF for CI/CD pipelines.
formatter_well_formatted: Your Markdown is already well formatted!
formatter_run_to_lint: Run Format to generate lint results
formatter_passes_rules: Your current content passes all enabled rules.
formatter_lint_hint: Lint results will appear after formatting.
formatter_what_is_desc:
Markdown Formatter is a safe and reviewable Markdown formatting tool.

It automatically fixes common formatting issuesâ€”such as spacing, headings, lists, blockquotes, and code fencesâ€”using deterministic and non-destructive rules.
All changes are previewed with a diff view before being applied, so you always know exactly what will change.

Unlike traditional formatters that reformat everything at once, Markdown Formatter focuses on minimal, predictable changes that improve readability and consistency without altering your content's meaning.

It also includes an advanced lint and quality mode, allowing you to detect structural and writing-quality issues when needed.
formatter_who_is_for_li1: Developers maintaining README files and documentation
formatter_who_is_for_li2: Writers and content creators using Markdown
formatter_who_is_for_li3: Teams that care about consistent formatting and clean diffs
formatter_who_is_for_li4: Anyone who wants safe auto-formatting without surprises
formatter_how_it_works_intro: Markdown Formatter follows a review-first formatting workflow:
formatter_how_it_works_step1_desc:
Your Markdown is parsed using a token-based analyzer to identify common formatting issues such as spacing, headings, lists, and code blocks.

Only issues that can be fixed safely and deterministically are selected for automatic formatting.
formatter_how_it_works_step2_desc:
Each enabled rule applies minimal, line-based changes to fix formatting issues without rewriting content or restructuring the document.

This approach ensures:

No semantic changes

No aggressive reformatting

Predictable and consistent results
formatter_how_it_works_step3_desc:
Before applying any changes, you can review all modifications using a side-by-side diff view with word-level highlighting.

You can switch between diff and preview modes to fully understand the impact of each change.
formatter_how_it_works_step4_desc:
Once reviewed, you can:

Apply all changes

Undo formatting at any time

Enable advanced mode to customize rules, presets, or run lint and quality checks

You are always in control of the final result.
formatter_how_it_works_summary:
Markdown Formatter doesn't just format your Markdown â€”
it helps you format with confidence.
formatter_rule_heading_depth_desc: Headings should not exceed the configured depth.
formatter_rule_long_paragraph_desc: Paragraph is too long; consider breaking it up.
not_found_description: Sorry, the page you are looking for does not exist. It may have been moved or deleted.
